column4: Hello there, I'm sorry to bother, I'm new here, I have a question regarding Ubuntu 12.10
Hello there, I'm sorry to bother, I'm new here, I have a question regarding Ubuntu 12.10, sorry to repeat myself
regarding the well known error "Adding read ACL uid 1000", I've searched the internet, but nothing could have helped me
what do you mean? what i did to reach this point
your first user is UID 1000
the username you use is just a pretty mask for that number
doesn't the CD contain windows drivers only?
what wifi chip are you using?
run:  sudo lshw -C network    there will be a product line which tells you the chip
I'm back, I have the same problem with all my CD's plus my USB
I think the most easiest way to fix this is to install the 12.04 version of Ubuntu? even if I don't want, I want to struggle a little bit with this
could go for a clean install of 12.10 first
install build-essential to get a compiling environment :)
which file?
you don't have to put it anywhere special, you can compile in terminal
desktop is fine
you will need to run:    cd ~/Desktop    first
or the interpretter won't find the file
read above
I'd ask in #c++
